Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jodi7722
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn for two weeks with my daughter, who was there for medical tests and doctors' appointments. From the moment I walked in the front doors of the hotel, I was immediately impressed. The hotel far exceeded my expectations from cleanliness to outstanding service. My family and I have stayed at many Holiday Inns but none as extraordinary as this one. The modern decor, gorgeous hand blown light fixtures, contemporary vanities and fabulous, comfortable furniture reminded me of a five star hotel. The designer of this hotel took every step to make guests comfortable and feel at home, even adding reading lights at each bedside and at the over sized chairs in the room. This was a special touch. The indoor pool was magnificent and there was a wonderful work out room, which we used often. Not only was I impressed with the decor, but I was equally impressed with the great service and Southern hospitality that I experienced during my two week stay. The Holiday Inn management took what would have been a stressful time in my life and turned it in to a much needed relaxing vacation. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Setting the Standard”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easily the coolest, most modern and best Priority Club property out there. I've stayed in dozens and dozens and dozens of PC hotels and this tops them all. The rooms were spectacular. The lobby was ultra-cool. Staff was super-friendly. Everything about this hotel is excellent. I will have a difficult time staying elsewhere after my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wrgriffith01
Reviews.Content: I first have to say the hotel was nice and clean with great customer service the room was large and comfortable. However for the price I paid I was somewhat disappointed. The television did not work correctly I had to punch in the channel that I wanted to go to every time. There was no bath in the room which took me totally by surprise only a stand up shower, I have never stayed at a hotel that didn't have bath. One other thing that is my fault because I guess I should have asked, was the standard rooms don't have a microwave or refrigerator. That is my fault for not checking but for what I paid for the room I just amused it would have those things. All in all it was average and I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice holiday inn express”
Reviews.Author: Fountain38
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new property and is very well operated. Nice rooms---no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jaytex03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight for a quick getaway with the family while visiting the Galleria. Check-in was quick and efficient. Impressed with the clean modern room and bathroom. Features seemed like what you would find in a pricier hotel. Did not get to check out the pool or workout facilities. The breakfast was excellent and is the standard HIE hot breakfast. Dining area was clean and well laid out. I will definitely return when I need to stay in the area. My only complaint is about the comfort of the bed. Too stiff, unless you like really firm matresses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but what is with letting a scam take over the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Frank C
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel, its conveniently located next to shopping and plenty of restaurants. Convenient parking (unless ambit energy scam is taking over hotel). The room was really nice size and tidy, its a new hotel and it shows. Its clean, modern, nice breakfast and internet, all the things I look for in a business hotel. The bathroom size was nice, very modern, and very clean. I usually stay at Hyatt Place in Plano but thought I would give this a shot as it was comparable and considerably less expensive. Definitely would stay here again and recommend it to colleagues. However I hope the hotel management reconsiders letting multilevel marketing scams like Ambit take over their hotel such that regular guests cant find parking and have to weave our way through throngs of people getting the "you too can be a part of this opportunity for $429" speech just to get to the elevators. Ambit revival meeting aside, its a nice clean modern new hotel with a friendly helpful staff. Give it a try

Reviews.Title: “new modern hotel but staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: mr_maizeblu
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel and when we got there and went to our room we were quite surprised that we were given a handicapped access room. the room had a shower that had two floor drains - one in the shower area and one in the center of the floor. while taking a shower the water flowed up against the wall under the sink area instead of going to the center drain. 1 third of the floor was soaked and you couldn't get to the sink without either mopping up all the water with one of the bath towels or getting your feet wet. it got so bad that water started to leak thru the ceiling into the elevator lobby below. we had two issues that required us to contact the desk for help. in both cases the front desk people did not take care of the problem while we were there. the afternoon clerk treated us like we were an annoyance. last, but not least, they only had one rolling cart to use to take our belongings to and from our car.

Reviews.Title: “HIE - Dallas , Galleria is worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: ltjld
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay very much. Not the typical HIE, and we had the two bedroom suite, which is rare to find. We enjoyed the room and the front desk staff was very polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: CatwomanNY
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations at this hotel through American Express Travel, not my usual method of using the Holiday Inn website directly, so I expected problems when I checked in. There were none! The front desk staff were always professional and courteous. The breakfast was hot, fresh, and fully stocked. The decor was outstanding in the lobby and common areas and in the room appeared new! The 2 queen bed suite we reserved was plenty large enough for three adults and the cleaning crew kept it spotless. Overall, I really wish I could have found something wrong other than the road construction at the entrance to the driveway, but I can't and the hotel had no control over that. The best part, you couldn't hear a thing inside the hotel from that construction zone. I have no complaints only compliments! This hotel is in the perfect location. Close to shopping, restaurants, the airport, and right off the highway. I am going to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff! More Awesome rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Woodrow W
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on my company's travel website. They had just opened and I stay at numerous Holiday Inn Express hotels around the country. This one by far has the best rooms for a great price! The rooms are all decked out in a kind of Feng Shai style, as well as the lobby. The staff is excellent! I visit Dallas sporadically but I guess enough that just about everyone that has worked the front desk knows me by name. I had just made platinum status about a week before my last visit there and it was already updated on their computers. I was recognized as a platinum member and was given a complimentary upgrade to a suite! Cool! Funny thing, I visited the Holiday Inn in Buena Park California the very next week. No recognition of being platinum, no upgrade, on my check in document, they still had my PC as Gold. When I asked if that could be changed, I was told in a somewhat rude fashion, " You have to change that online." When I was walking away, the person rudely gave me a complimentary bag of a bottle of water and a granola bar. Thanks. On my profile, it states King bed. So did my reservation. When I got to the room, it was a double. That's it! Won't be staying there any longer. Too bad for them. I am a loyal customer and was staying one week per month at that hotel for close to a year! I did talk to the manager and received an upgrade but too late. I got off track there. Anyway, this hotel in Dallas is a very nice hotel. If you like Holiday Inn Express Hotels and are looking for one in the Dallas area, this IS your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Maurice F
Reviews.Content: This has by far been my fav hotel when visiting Dallas, every other week on business. From the staff to everything about the rooms.... its all great! keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest Holiday Inn Express I've ever seen. Great decor and GREAT rooms. I love the indoor pool and the breakfast was great! Two thumbs up for the great staff and I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary look, clean, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: agent86SanJose
Reviews.Content: - Great North Dallas location, close to Galleria Mall (Macy's, Nordstrom) - Convenient to highways (LBJ Freeway, I75) - Ceiling fan in room, internet access included with room rate - Good Breakfast (eggs, pancakes, pastry, orange juice, apple juice, bagel, yogurt) - Walgreens located in same parking lot - Very comfortable bed - Lots of restaurants and retail shopping close by - A negative is Valley View Mall across the street is almost dead. Only major dept store open is JC Penny - Bathroom toilet roll holder was loose and was never fixed during our 7 day stay

Reviews.Title: “Now my first choice of hotels in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: Linda Kaye R
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel especially if you need to stay near Medical City Hospital.

Reviews.Title: “bad stay”
Reviews.Author: rjonesy50
Reviews.Content: First night door would not lock,towel rack fell off,second night got in room after 4PM maid still in room,TV did not work till after 7PM,side of bed rail fell off third night snack food offered between 5;30-7;00 at 6;20 there was no food or beer left for at least 3 other guest,bed was very hard,mold around tub needed to stay one other night but needed to pack move things to different room not worth the price there was other small things, over priced,spelling on tripadvisor card not correct on hotel name

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe this was a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: worldseeker52
Reviews.Content: New and trendy hotel with attractive rate. I've stayed in Holiday Inns and they don't look like this. Spacious suites and bathroom. The staff was super. Other friends were leaving at 6am, the staff made coffee and got them something to eat before the official breakfast hour. Check the times the shuttle runs to the airport. Also, when you arrive call to let them know you are waiting for a pick up from the airport. Fantastic place

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, chic, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Tarheelchix80
Reviews.Content: Trendy, new, hotel convenient to The Galleria. Decor felt like one of those modern West Coast boutique hotels. Clean and quiet. Friendly front desk staff. Night time security for parking lot. Wish my schedule had allowed for more than a one-night stay. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “We love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce1961
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel 3 times in the recent past...the most recent being Mar. 15 - 17, 2011. We love the cleanliness and decor (modern) of the Hotel, as well as the helpfulness of the staff! Our children enjoyed the Indoor Pool and we LOVED the Hot tub! My only complaint would be about the continental breakfast...i.e. on the final morning, we didn't get down to eat until ~9:15 (our fault!) and several of the items were already out of stock and we had to ask for them. The attendent wasn't very friendly, either. Other than that, we were completely satisified with our stay. If you're ever in the area, give Melissa and her staff a call! I 'm sure you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe we were at a Holiday Inn Express!”
Reviews.Author: killerkells
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night - we were going out in Dallas for New Year's Eve and then visiting family in Farmers Branch on New Year's Day. While we didn't have an extended stay, our experience was very positive. The lobby looks nothing like you'd expect from a Holiday Inn Express - very well designed, modern and cool. We spent time there eating breakfast (the normal choices, but everything was well-stocked and immaculate) and waiting to meet a friend and were pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean, had a modern vibe to it and had obviously been refurbished recently. The bathroom was a good size, and once again - very very clean. The bed was really comfortable, and the room matched pictures I'd seen online. The hotel was an an excellent location for us, and would be good for people wanting to shop at the Galleria - but please note, you will NOT be able to walk there. There's a Walgreens next door and several fast food restaurants around. I would definitely definitely definitely here again.

Reviews.Title: “I really like these Holiday Inn Express Hotels”
Reviews.Author: 2funsun1
Reviews.Content: I just want to say I love this chain now. Very clean and affordable and in good locations. Usually chains like this can't keep up over time, but for now, these places are great! As far as this location: the Galleria area is about 3 miles of restaurant heaven. We asked, and the story is that when the area was developed 25 years ago it was planned to have the most liberal liquor laws in the area to attract as many restaurants as possible. It worked. And they're very good to excellent. There are some blocks with only restaurants and nothing else. Plan on "restaurant hopping" and getting appetizers at a few in walking distance of each other.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical HI Express!”
Reviews.Author: stefanwt
Reviews.Content: I attended a local event and chose this HI Express since it was close and was brand new. The decor is stunning, both in and outside the rooms. More like a chic boutique hotel than a HI. The lobby area bathrooms revaled a trendy night club. I was very impressed! Check in was quick, the room was emmaculately clean and fresh. My bathroom had a European shower which was such a treat. The bed was comforatable and I had a great nights sleep. I got down to breakfast about 9am and there was limited if not nothing available in the hot food trays. I waited a few minutes and the attendant brough some scrambled eggs which almost disappeared once she put them in. There was no bacon or any of the cheese stuff omletes I saw other people finishing up. In all it was a ery pleasant stay and very trendy, chic hotel. I'd recommend it and the room rates are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: KStraveler2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this "new" hotel last week. It is a new hotel with a nice room. Unfortunately, I awoke the next morning with the back window of my vehicle smashed out, with some personal items stolen. Then I discovered that the same criminals broke into at least 3 other vehicles the same night. The manager's response was "what did you leave in your vehicle that would make someone want to break into it." My personal items were covered up and my windows were tinted. The thieves were professional. There were no fingerprints found on any of the vehicles. After speaking with the police, it turns out that the previous hotel had a major crime problem. So a new hotel was built, but the same crime remains. The management knows there are problems here, but has refused to install a security system with cameras to protect its guests and help the police. On one side of the building you will notice a wall with adjacent private property. If you look over the wall, you will see additional broken vehicle glass and debris laying on that property. Overall, protect your personal property and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasLight
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Holiday Inn Express 3 times since March because of nearby Dr. appointments. Holiday Inn's are not usually my favorite but we got a fantastic price right after they first opened so we tried it out. It was beautifully decorated and the staff was so nice. As others have commented, breakfast goes fast. I made that comment to the desk person upon checkout (to be fair, it was spring break) and the 2 times I have been back it wasn't an issue anymore. This last time we didn't make it down until 8:45 on a Saturday and there as plenty of food. The second time I was here we didn't discover that the A.C. wasn't working until the morning we left (it was cooler because of rain so we didn't try to turn it on till we were getting ready in the morning) so we didn't mess with a service call. The rooms have a ceiling fan which really helps keep it cool. Again, I told the desk when we left. My friend forgot something in the room and went back about 20 minutes after we checked out and found a maintenance man already in the room, and her item was still there! Everytime I stay here I want to go home and remodel my bathroom. One thing I didn't like this last trip - we all woke up with sore backs both nights. I didn't notice this on the previous 2 stays so will stay here again. North Park Mall is very close by as is the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fibbersfan
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is well maintained and clean throughout! The housekeeping was excellent and the staff were very helpful! My daughter and I spent a lot of time in the indoor pool area and had a great time! We were glad the pool was inside because we Seattleites are not used to the heat! The pool area was clean and had four colored streams of water flowing into the pool. No complaints! Good price and great service! Blaine at the front desk made us feel welcomed and went out of his way to help out (when we burnt our popcorn).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel..and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: martinezfam41
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and i would stay here again, not very hard to find the hotel even though we dont know Dallas at all. first day- since we had a reservation we went to see if they could get us in our room early than normal time, the man checked us in and told us it would be a hour wait, didnt have a problem with that he made changes and got us a room right a way, room was clean and very stunning (better in real life than the pictures). second day- breakfast room was full but really didnt matter to us because we ate in our room, went swiming later that day and pool was great (better than what i expected), that day we went to a maverick game and the whole reason why we went to Dallas we called front desk to set up a taxi to go to the America Airlines Center, they set one up for us and very friendly about it...service was great all around and i would recomend you to stay here....because me and my family will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I would NEVER stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: aftershock71121
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel that has a beautiful elegance unfortunately their need for high tech has over-shadowed the hotel. ROOM - 2 room suite - Air/heat unable to understand thermostat, room was considerable cold since heat wouldn't come on. Fan/Light in second bedroom didn't work. LED lights in second bedroom didn't work. No refrigerator or microwave in these suites. Wireless internet was non-existant - desk in this particular room did not have ether-net. BATHROOM - The bathroom was luxurious with a nice shower and whirlpool. HOUSEKEEPING - didn't clean the second room, the bathroom (which had someone else's dirty kleenex behind the sink), the didn't refill the kleenex, coffee, nor personal care ammentities. SWIMMING POOL - The pool was so cold and the hot tub so hot it was not enjoyable. BREAKFAST - The had a sold-out hotel but were not ready for it. Both mornings they were out of food and had no where to sit. Breakfast was until 10 and we went down at 9. STAFF - when voicing a problem this staff was down right rude. They always put the problem back on the customer. They were not responsive when the problem with the heat arose since their maintenance person wasn't on property. They just didn't seem to care that the room had no heat even with two babies.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel -- Indoor Pool & Spa”
Reviews.Author: cssct1988
Reviews.Content: During the months of Jan-April we travel to the Dallas area several times for Club Volleyball tournaments. In March we were looking for a hotel close to the Sportsplex on Alpha Road and found a great rate ($50 range) @ the Holiday Inn. When booking the room (Double Queen beds) I didn't notice the age of the hotel only that it had the type room I was looking for, was just over a mile from our venue and it was a trusted name in hotels. When we arrived the staff was extremely helpful, they had actually upgraded us @ the same price to a King suite but we explained we really needed the double Queen room and they were very accomodating. Everything was nice and clean and the staff including the maid service went out of their way to make our stay very comfortable. The first suggestion I would make is: Have a listings in the room of available channels the TV was a little confusing, but this could have been due to the fact they had only been open a short time and were still working out the kinks. Secondly, the sink in the bathroom is gorgeous but it is a little high and last the walls in the bathroom are a bit thin but didn't seem that way in the main room. I liked this hotel so much we are staying there again this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel very close to the Galleria”
Reviews.Author: thewizard16
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on my priority club website when the Crowne Plaza I normally stay at in Dallas was booked. I am pretty familiar with the area, but could not remember seeing this hotel. When I arrived, I realized why. As of 2/22/10 the Holiday Inn Express (Galleria) has only been open about 3 weeks! It is a brand new hotel with an very modern decor theme throughout. It's by far the nicest Holiday Inn Express I've stayed at so far. The rooms are relatively large with a roomy work area next to the beds. The room has a flat panel TV, but as of my visit the cable was not yet set up properly so it was a bit difficult to find channels. The bathroom is very contemporary and is clearly trying to be very nice, but the sink is very high and this could be a problem for families with smaller children. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the breakfast was surprisingly good. It also has a very nice, but small, fitness center and a pool with LED colored fountains flowing into it, which are a nice touch. There is also a decent amount of meeting space on the first floor. The staff was friendly and service was above average for a hotel in this price category. The only minor concerns I had with the hotel were access- you don't see the sign until you're pretty much right next to the hotel so keep an eye out for it and stay in the right lane on the frontage road, and little things that are likely due to the hotels recent opening. The TV is not yet configured properly, their waterfalls in the lobby were shut down because they needed to reseal them it appeared, and one of the LED booklight fixtures in my room didn't work. I think the kinks will probably get worked out of the hotel shortly though, and certainly don't constitute a reason not to stay there. It is extremely close to the Valley View Shopping Center and the Galleria. It is not quite walking distance, but Valley View is very close on the same frontage road as the hotel and the Galleria is just up past that. A great location for access and shopping/dining.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Dallas (Galleria Area)
HotelInfo.Address: 6055 LBJ Freeway, Dallas, TX 75240
